alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding along the Black Fork Mohican River caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following county, Ashland. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM EDT, At 245 pm, the river stage along the Black Fork Mohican River at Loudonville was 10.32 feet and rising. - Some low lying campgrounds along the river may become inundated as the river rises. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loudonville and Perrysville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
